title: Windows 8.1 AIO x86 x64 [EN] [November.2014-NiKKA]
description:
NiKKA p r e s e n t s :    
                   
Windows.8.1.AIO.EN.x86.x64.November.2014-NiKKA
Version x86 - 32bit & x64 - 64bit in one installer (AIO) - 6 installation to choice

32bit - Core, Pro, Pro with Media Center
64bit - Core, Pro, Pro with Media Center

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Description:

Info: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Windows_8.1

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Info:

Source: Latest ESD versions (2014.09)

Type: System, x86 - 32bit, x64 - 64bit
Language: English
Volume: 1xDVD9, bootable ISO, bootable USB
Create Date: 2014.12.02
Release Date: 2014.12.02
By: NiKKA


Contents:

- Integrated updates up to 2014.11 (November rollup included)
- Integrated .NET 3.5 (contains .NET 2.0 i 3.0)
- Updated DirectX
- Versions 32bit to install: Core, Pro, Pro with Media Center
- Versions 64bit to install: Core, Pro, Pro with Media Center
- You can install with your original key
- OEM or Retail/Box key - read activation.txt


Instruction:

Size ISO: 5,83 GB (bytes: 6Ã‚Â 266Ã‚Â 769Ã‚Â 408)
SHA1 ISO: f337dce33a71b9434de447ab9ece7a2bba9858c2

Burn ISO on DVD (DVD9) or mount in daemon or VMware or prepare bootable USB (8GB minimum):
Use: Rufus or other progz, or make manualy bootable USB:

How prepare bootable USB to install Windows Vista, 7, 8, 8.1:

WARNING! You do this at your own risk! Further steps delete the contents of the USB drive!
Make a copy of the earlier if you need to!

console => cmd [enter]
diskpart [enter...]

list disk
select disk [select your disk USB - carefully!]
clean
create partition primary
select partition 1
active
format fs=ntfs quick
assign

exit
exit

copy whole DVD/.ISO on USB
install system


Activation - read info in activation.txt

Cleaned WinSxS:
Dism.exe /online /Cleanup-Image /AnalyzeComponentStore
Dism.exe /online /Cleanup-Image /StartComponentCleanup (without /ResetBase - it's Your decision)


Install.esd
Install.wim file was exported (highly compressed) to install.esd (/compress:recovery, file size was reduced from 6.83GB to 5.40GB)


Others:
UEFI Boot is not supported in AIO.
Recovery mode is x86 - 32bit (must be 32bit in AIO). If you want to install in UEFI mode, download a separate version x64 - 64bit.


System settings unchanged. Integrated via Slipstream&Sysprep. Mastering via scripts (DISM, IMAGEX, OSCDIMG, CMD)
